summary: Metagenomics offers a vast potential for discovering novel enzymes that can be used in industrial applications, particularly in the pharmaceutical and fine-chemicals industries, where diversity and novelty are crucial.
key_claims: Metagenomics has the potential to impact industrial production by providing diverse enzyme functions.
Industries seek uncultivated microbial diversity for creating new enzymes that can be used as building blocks or toolboxes in biotransformations.

_abstract: Different industries have different motivations to probe the enormous resource that is uncultivated microbial diversity. Currently, there is a global political drive to promote white (industrial) biotechnology as a central feature of the sustainable economic future of modern industrialized societies. This requires the development of novel enzymes, processes, products and applications. Metagenomics promises to provide new molecules with diverse functions, but ultimately, expression systems are required for any new enzymes and bioactive molecules to become an economic success. This review highlights industrial efforts and achievements in metagenomics.
